name: Alpaca
fact: Alpaca fiber is fire-resistant and comes in 22 natural colors!

name: Chicken
fact: Chickens have over 30 different vocalizations and can dream!

name: Cow
fact: Cows have best friends and get stressed when they're separated!

name: Donkey
fact: Donkeys have incredible memories and can recognize places they haven't seen in 25 years!

name: Duck
fact: Ducklings will follow the first moving thing they see - even if it's not their mother!

name: Goat
fact: Goats have accents - their bleats change depending on their social group!

name: Goose
fact: Geese mate for life and mourn their dead partners!

name: Horse
fact: Horses can sleep standing up using a system of tendons and ligaments!

name: Llama
fact: Llamas can carry up to 30% of their body weight and will spit when angry!

name: Mule
fact: Mules are smarter than horses and have better endurance than donkeys!

name: Pig
fact: Pigs are smarter than dogs and can learn to play video games!

name: Pony
fact: Ponies are stronger than horses relative to their size!

name: Rooster
fact: Roosters can tell time and often crow just before sunrise!

name: Sheep
fact: Sheep can recognize up to 50 different human faces and remember them for years!

name: Turkey
fact: Wild turkeys can fly up to 88 km/h but domestic turkeys can't fly!

name: American Crow
fact: Crows can recognize human faces and remember them for years!

name: Anole Lizard
fact: Anoles can change color from green to brown depending on their mood!

name: Ant
fact: Manta rays have the largest brain of any fish!

name: Border Collie
fact: Border collies are the smartest dog breed and can learn over 1,000 words!

name: Canada Goose
fact: Canada geese fly in a V formation to save energy on long trips!

name: Cockatiel
fact: Male cockatiels are better at talking and females are better at whistling!

name: Common Grackle
fact: Grackles can mimic sounds including car alarms!

name: Coyote
fact: Coyotes can mate with dogs and wolves and can jump 4 meters high!

name: European Starling
fact: Starlings can mimic human speech and sing complex songs!

name: Feral Cat
fact: Feral Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Ferret
fact: Ferrets sleep up to 18 hours a day and are most active at dawn and dusk!

name: Garden Snail
fact: Garden snails have thousands of tiny teeth on their tongue!

name: Golden Retriever
fact: Golden retrievers have 'soft mouths' and can carry eggs without breaking them!

name: Goldfish
fact: Goldfish can recognize faces and can be trained to push levers for food!

name: Grey Squirrel
fact: Grey Squirrels can find buried nuts even under snow!

name: Guinea Pig
fact: Guinea pigs can't make their own vitamin C and must get it from food!

name: Hamster
fact: Hamsters have pouches in their cheeks that can stretch to their shoulders!

name: Honey Bee
fact: Bees dance to tell other bees where to find flowers!

name: House Finch
fact: Male house finches get their red color from berries they eat!

name: House Sparrow
fact: House sparrows take dust baths to keep their feathers clean!

name: Magpie
fact: Magpies are one of the few animals that can recognize themselves in a mirror!

name: Monarch Butterfly
fact: Monarch butterflies travel 3000 miles every year!

name: Parakeet
fact: Parakeets can learn over 100 words and live up to 20 years!

name: Parakeet (Feral)
fact: Parakeets can learn over 100 words and live 20 years!

name: Peregrine Falcon
fact: Peregrine falcons are the fastest animals, diving at 240 mph!

name: Pot-bellied Pig
fact: Pot-bellied pigs can learn to use a litter box and respond to their name!

name: Rabbit
fact: Rabbits can jump nearly 1 meter high and have 360-degree vision!

name: Red-tailed Hawk
fact: Red-tailed hawk screams are used in movies for all eagles!

name: Rock Pigeon
fact: Rock Pigeons are smarter than dogs!

name: Seagull
fact: Seagulls can drink salt water because they have special glands that remove the salt!

name: Siamese Cat
fact: Siamese cats are born white and develop their points as they get older!

name: Tabby Cat
fact: Tabby cats have an M pattern on their forehead that's believed to be from Mohammed's blessing!

name: Turtle
fact: Turtles can breathe through their butt when underwater!

name: American Black Bear
fact: American Black Bears can smell food from 20 miles away!

name: Blue Jay
fact: Blue jays can mimic hawk calls to scare other birds away from food!

name: Bobcat
fact: Bobcats spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Box Turtle
fact: Box turtles can live over 100 years and remember where food grows!

name: Chipmunk
fact: Chipmunks can carry food in their cheek pouches and store up to 8 kg of nuts for winter!

name: Cooper's Hawk
fact: Coopers hawks can fly through dense forests at high speed!

name: Eastern Gray Squirrel
fact: Eastern Gray Squirrels can find buried nuts even under snow!

name: Elk
fact: Elk can jump 2.4 meters high and their antlers can grow 2.5 cm per day!

name: European Robin
fact: Robins can see magnetic fields to navigate!

name: Garter Snake
fact: Garter snakes are harmless and eat garden pests!

name: Moose
fact: Moose antlers can grow up to 2 meters wide and fall off every winter!

name: Pileated Woodpecker
fact: Pileated woodpeckers make holes big enough for owls to use!

name: Pine Marten
fact: Pine martens can catch squirrels in trees!

name: Porcupine
fact: Porcupines have up to 30,000 quills that they can shoot out when threatened!

name: Raven
fact: Ravens can solve puzzles and even play tricks on each other!

name: Red Fox
fact: Red Foxes can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: White-tailed Deer
fact: White-tailed Deer grow new antlers every single year!

name: Wild Boar
fact: Wild boars have tough skin that can stop arrows and they're excellent swimmers!

name: Wild Turkey
fact: Wild turkeys can fly up to 55 miles per hour!

name: Wood Frog
fact: Wood frogs freeze solid in winter and thaw alive in spring!

name: Blue Morpho Butterfly
fact: Blue morpho wings shimmer because of tiny scales, not pigment!

name: Capybara
fact: Capybaras are the worlds largest rodents and love to swim!

name: Cassowary
fact: Cassowaries have a helmet-like crest and powerful kicks!

name: Chimpanzee
fact: Chimps use tools like sticks to catch termites!

name: Gorilla
fact: Gorillas can learn sign language!

name: Green Anaconda
fact: Green Anacondas can swallow animals bigger than their head!

name: Harpy Eagle
fact: Harpy Eagles can spot a rabbit from 2 miles away!

name: Howler Monkey
fact: Howler Monkeys can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Jaguar
fact: Jaguars have the strongest bite of all big cats!

name: Leafcutter Ant
fact: Leafcutter ants don't eat leaves - they use them to grow fungus that they eat!

name: Macaw
fact: Macaws can live over 80 years and mate for life!

name: Okapi
fact: Okapis are the only living relatives of giraffes and have zebra-striped legs!

name: Orangutan
fact: Orangutans build a new nest to sleep in every night!

name: Poison Dart Frog
fact: One tiny poison dart frog has enough venom to harm 10 people!

name: Rhinoceros Hornbill
fact: Hornbills have a hollow horn that makes their calls louder!

name: Spider Monkey
fact: Spider monkeys have a prehensile tail that works like a fifth arm!

name: Tapir
fact: Tapirs are related to horses and rhinos and can use their nose as a snorkel!

name: Three-toed Sloth
fact: Three-toed Sloths are so slow that algae grows on their fur!

name: Toucan
fact: A toucan's bill is light and hollow like a honeycomb!

name: Tree Kangaroo
fact: Baby kangaroos are called joeys and live in mom's pouch!

name: Addax
fact: Addax can survive months in the desert without drinking water!

name: Arctic Fox
fact: Arctic Foxes can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: Arctic Wolf
fact: Wolves howl to talk to their pack from far away!

name: Aye-Aye
fact: Aye-ayes have a long middle finger they use to tap on wood and find insects!

name: Badger
fact: Badgers can dig through concrete and their jaws can lock onto prey with incredible force!

name: Banded Coral Shrimp
fact: Cleaner shrimp set up stations where fish line up for cleaning!

name: Bark Scorpion
fact: Bark scorpions can survive being frozen and thaw back to life!

name: Basket Star
fact: Basket stars are starfish with arms that branch out like a basket to catch floating food!

name: Big Brown Bat
fact: Big Brown Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly!

name: Bigeye Soldierfish
fact: Soldierfish have huge eyes to see in the dark reef!

name: Bighorn Sheep
fact: Bighorn sheep rams crash heads at 20 miles per hour!

name: Black Crappie
fact: Crappies build nests and guard their eggs!

name: Black-crowned Night Heron
fact: Night herons drop bait to lure fish!

name: Bobtail Squid
fact: Bobtail squid glow in the dark to hide their shadow from predators!

name: Boreal Owl
fact: Boreal Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Brittle Star
fact: Brittle stars can drop their arms to escape and regrow them!

name: Brown Rat
fact: Rats laugh when tickled and can be trained to play hide and seek!

name: Bullfrog
fact: Bullfrogs can eat anything they can fit in their mouth, even birds!

name: Burbot
fact: Burbot are the only freshwater fish in the cod family!

name: Cactus Wren
fact: Cactus wrens build nests inside spiny cacti for protection!

name: California Spiny Lobster
fact: Spiny lobsters migrate in long single-file lines!

name: Camel Spider
fact: Camel spiders are not spiders and cannot hurt humans!

name: Caracal
fact: Caracals can leap 10 feet in the air to catch birds!

name: Cardinalfish
fact: Male cardinalfish carry eggs in their mouths!

name: Catfish
fact: Catfishs spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Cave Boa
fact: Cave boas catch bats flying out of caves!

name: Cave Crayfish
fact: Cave crayfish are white from living in darkness!

name: Cave Cricket
fact: Cave crickets have extra long antennae to feel in the dark!

name: Cave Rat
fact: Cave rats help spread seeds near cave entrances!

name: Cave Salamander
fact: Cave salamanders glow orange and live 20 years!

name: Cave Shrimp
fact: Cave shrimp are see-through and live in underground streams!

name: Cave Spider
fact: Cave spiders spin webs in total darkness!

name: Cave Swiftlet
fact: Swiftlets build nests from their own saliva!

name: Centipede
fact: Despite their name, centipedes never have exactly 100 legs!

name: Chuckwalla
fact: Chuckwallas puff up in rock cracks so predators cant pull them out!

name: Clouded Leopard
fact: Clouded leopards can hang upside down from branches!

name: Common Octopus
fact: Common Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood!

name: Common Snapping Turtle
fact: Snapping turtles have a bite force of 1000 pounds!

name: Conger Eel
fact: Conger eels can grow over 9 feet long!

name: Cookiecutter Shark
fact: Cookiecutter Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Crayfish
fact: Crayfish can regenerate their claws if they lose them!

name: Decorator Crab
fact: Decorator crabs stick things to their shell for camouflage!

name: Deep-sea Hatchetfish
fact: Hatchetfish use lights to hide their shadow from below!

name: Desert Hedgehog
fact: Desert Hedgehogs have about 5,000 spines on their back!

name: Desert Tortoise
fact: Desert tortoises dig burrows to escape the heat!

name: Dromedary Camel
fact: Camels can drink 30 gallons of water in 13 minutes!

name: Eel
fact: Eels can travel over land when it rains to find new ponds!

name: Elf Owl
fact: Elf Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Emperor Scorpion
fact: Emperor scorpions glow bright blue under UV light!

name: Fennec Fox
fact: Fennec Foxes can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: Firefly
fact: Fireflies flash in patterns to attract mates and some synchronize their flashes!

name: Firefly Squid
fact: Firefly squid light up the ocean with blue glow!

name: Fishing Cat
fact: Fishing Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Flashlight Fish
fact: Flashlight fish have organs under their eyes that produce bright light!

name: Flying Fox
fact: Flying Foxes can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: Flying Squirrel
fact: Flying Squirrels can find buried nuts even under snow!

name: Freshwater Crab
fact: Freshwater crabs can breathe air and walk on land!

name: Freshwater Shrimp
fact: Freshwater shrimp keep water clean by eating algae!

name: Fruit Bat
fact: Fruit Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly!

name: Galago (Bushbaby)
fact: Bushbabies can jump 6 feet straight up!

name: Gecko
fact: Geckos can walk on walls using microscopic hairs that create molecular attraction!

name: Ghost Crab
fact: Ghost crabs can run sideways at 10 miles per hour!

name: Giant Salamander
fact: Giant salamanders can grow over 5 feet long!

name: Gila Monster
fact: Gila monsters are one of the only venomous lizards in the world!

name: Glowworm
fact: Glowworms light up cave ceilings like tiny stars!

name: Great Horned Owl
fact: Great Horned Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Greenland Shark
fact: Greenland Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Horned Lizard
fact: Horned lizards can squirt blood from their eyes to scare predators!

name: Horseshoe Crab
fact: Horseshoe Crabs can sleep standing up!

name: House Mouse
fact: Mice can squeeze through holes as small as a dime!

name: Humboldt Squid
fact: Humboldt squid hunt in packs and flash colors to talk!

name: Hyena (Denning)
fact: Hyenas have the strongest bite of almost any mammal!

name: Jerboa
fact: Jerboas can hop 3 meters high and use their tail for balance!

name: Kangaroo Rat
fact: Baby kangaroos are called joeys and live in mom's pouch!

name: Kinkajou
fact: Kinkajous have a 5-inch long tongue they use to reach nectar in flowers!

name: Kit Fox
fact: Kit Foxes can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: Krill
fact: Krill are the most abundant animal species on Earth with a total weight of 500 million tons!

name: Lanternfish
fact: Lanternfish have light-producing organs called photophores that glow in the dark!

name: Lionfish
fact: Lionfishs are the only cats that live in groups called prides!

name: Little Brown Bat
fact: Little Brown Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly!

name: Luna Moth
fact: Luna moths have no mouth and only live for about a week!

name: Lynx
fact: Lynx have huge paws that work like snowshoes to help them walk on snow!

name: Margay
fact: Margays can mimic the sounds of baby monkeys to lure prey!

name: Marsh Owl
fact: Marsh Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Meerkat
fact: Meerkats take turns standing guard while others look for food!

name: Mexican Free-tailed Bat
fact: Mexican Free-tailed Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly!

name: Mexican Tetra (Blind Cave Fish)
fact: Cave fish lost their eyes because they dont need them!

name: Millipede
fact: Millipedes curl into a ball and release stinky chemicals when scared!

name: Mink
fact: Minks can swim underwater and catch fish with their sharp teeth!

name: Monitor Lizard
fact: Monitor lizards have forked tongues like snakes to smell prey!

name: Moray Eel
fact: Moray eels have a second set of jaws in their throat that grab prey and pull it down!

name: Moth
fact: Moths navigate by the moon and some can fly up to 60 km/h!

name: Necturus (Mudpuppy)
fact: Mudpuppies keep their gills their whole life!

name: Northern Collared Lemming
fact: Lemmings are one of few rodents that turn white in winter!

name: Nudibranch
fact: Nudibranchs are sea slugs that come in thousands of bright colors and patterns!

name: Oilbird
fact: Oilbirds use echolocation like bats to fly in dark caves!

name: Olm (Proteus)
fact: Olms can live 100 years and survive 10 years without food!

name: Ostrich
fact: Ostrich eyes are bigger than their brains!

name: Otter
fact: Otters hold hands while sleeping so they do not drift apart!

name: Pacific Hagfish
fact: Hagfish produce buckets of slime when attacked!

name: Peccary (Javelina)
fact: Javelinas rub scent on each other to recognize family!

name: Possum
fact: Possums play dead so well that predators lose interest!

name: Pronghorn
fact: Pronghorns are the second fastest land animal after cheetahs!

name: Raccoon
fact: Raccoons have 'hands' with five fingers and can remember solutions to tasks for 3 years!

name: Red Fox (Urban)
fact: Red Fox (Urban)es can hear a mouse under the snow from far away!

name: Red Kangaroo
fact: Baby kangaroos are called joeys and live in mom's pouch!

name: Reef Shark
fact: Reef Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Roadrunner
fact: Roadrunners can run 20 miles per hour and catch rattlesnakes!

name: Sand Cat
fact: Sand Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Sea Cucumber
fact: Sea cucumbers can eject their guts to escape predators, then regrow them!

name: Short-tailed Weasel
fact: Weasels do a war dance to confuse their prey!

name: Sidewinder Rattlesnake
fact: Sidewinders move sideways to travel quickly over hot sand!

name: Skunk
fact: Skunk spray can be detected up to 3.5 km away and can cause temporary blindness!

name: Slow Loris
fact: Slow lorises are one of the few venomous mammals!

name: Snipe Eel
fact: Snipe eels have jaws that curve away from each other, making them look like a pair of scissors!

name: Spanish Dancer
fact: Spanish dancer sea slugs swim by rippling like a flamenco dress!

name: Spectacled Caiman
fact: Caimans are related to alligators!

name: Spectacled Eider
fact: Spectacled eiders have white goggle markings!

name: Spider (House)
fact: House spiders help by eating flies and mosquitoes!

name: Squirrelfish
fact: Squirrelfishs can find buried nuts even under snow!

name: Stoplight Loosejaw
fact: This fish has a lower jaw that can detach and swing forward to catch prey!

name: Striped Skunk
fact: Skunks warn predators by stomping their feet before spraying!

name: Sugar Glider
fact: Sugar gliders can glide up to 45 meters using a membrane between their legs!

name: Tarantula Hawk
fact: Tarantula hawks have one of the most painful stings of any insect!

name: Tarsier
fact: Tarsiers have the largest eyes relative to body size of any mammal!

name: Thorny Devil
fact: Thorny devils drink water through their skin!

name: Vampire Bat
fact: Vampire Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly!

name: Virginia Opossum
fact: Opossums are immune to most snake venom!

name: Vulture
fact: Vultures have stomach acid strong enough to kill diseases in rotten meat!

name: Walleye
fact: Walleyes can see in almost complete darkness!

name: Water Shrew
fact: Water shrews can run on top of water for short distances!

name: Whip-poor-will
fact: Whip-poor-wills repeat their call up to 1000 times without stopping!

name: Wolverine
fact: Wolverines can take down prey 10 times their size and have teeth strong enough to break bones!

name: Adelie Penguin
fact: Adelie Penguins propose to their mates with a pebble!

name: Arctic Hare
fact: Arctic hares can run up to 60 km/h and change from brown to white for winter!

name: Arctic Tern
fact: Arctic terns fly from pole to pole, the longest migration ever!

name: Atlantic Puffin
fact: Puffins can hold over 10 fish in their beak at once!

name: Beluga Whale
fact: Blue whales are the biggest animals that ever lived!

name: Crabeater Seal
fact: Crabeater Seals can hold their breath for up to 2 hours!

name: Dall Sheep
fact: Dall sheep climb steep cliffs to escape predators!

name: Emperor Penguin
fact: Emperor penguin dads keep eggs warm on their feet!

name: Ermine (Stoat)
fact: Ermines turn white in winter except for their black tail!

name: Harp Seal
fact: Harp Seals can hold their breath for up to 2 hours!

name: Lemming
fact: Contrary to myth, lemmings don't commit mass suicide - they migrate when populations get too high!

name: Leopard Seal
fact: Leopard Seals can hold their breath for up to 2 hours!

name: Musk Ox
fact: Musk oxen have underwool that's 8 times warmer than sheep's wool!

name: Narwhal
fact: Narwhals have a 3-meter long tooth that looks like a unicorn horn!

name: Polar Bear
fact: Polar bears have black skin under their white fur!

name: Ptarmigan
fact: Ptarmigans have feathered feet that act like snowshoes and change color with seasons!

name: Reindeer (Caribou)
fact: Reindeer (Caribou) grow new antlers every single year!

name: Snowy Owl
fact: Snowy Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around!

name: Walrus
fact: Walruses use their tusks to pull themselves onto ice!

name: Weddell Seal
fact: Weddell Seals can hold their breath for up to 2 hours!

name: Aggregate Anemone
fact: Anemones clone themselves by splitting in half!

name: American Alligator
fact: American Alligators have been around since dinosaur times!

name: Arapaima
fact: Arapaima are giant fish that breathe air!

name: Axolotl
fact: Axolotls can regrow their legs, tail, and even parts of their brain!

name: Beaver
fact: Beavers have orange teeth that never stop growing!

name: Black Oystercatcher
fact: Black Oystercatchers spend 70% of their lives sleeping!

name: Brown Trout
fact: Brown trout can jump 6 feet over waterfalls!

name: Chiton
fact: Chitons have eyes made of actual rock crystals!

name: Common Limpet
fact: Limpets have the strongest teeth of any animal!

name: Dragonfly
fact: Dragonflies can fly in any direction, even backwards!

name: Egret
fact: Egrets grow beautiful feathers called plumes during mating season!

name: Electric Eel
fact: Electric eels can produce 600 volts of electricity!

name: Fiddler Crab
fact: Male fiddler crabs have one giant claw they wave to attract females!

name: Flamingo
fact: Flamingos are pink because of the shrimp they eat!

name: Freshwater Dolphin
fact: Freshwater Dolphins sleep with one eye open!

name: Gar
fact: Baby kangaroos are called joeys and live in mom's pouch!

name: Gooseneck Barnacle
fact: Gooseneck barnacles travel the world attached to ships!

name: Great Blue Heron
fact: Great blue herons swallow fish whole, headfirst!

name: Green Frog
fact: Green frogs make a sound like plucking a banjo string!

name: Hellbender Salamander
fact: Hellbenders breathe through their wrinkly skin!

name: Hermit Crab
fact: Hermit crabs carry their homes on their backs and must find bigger shells as they grow!

name: Hippopotamus
fact: Hippos make their own pink sunscreen from their sweat!

name: Kingfisher
fact: Kingfishers dive into water at 25 miles per hour to catch fish!

name: Koi
fact: Koi fish can live over 200 years and recognize their owners!

name: Largemouth Bass
fact: Bass can eat prey almost as big as themselves!

name: Mallard Duck
fact: Mallard ducks sleep with one eye open to watch for danger!

name: Marine Iguana
fact: Marine iguanas sneeze out salt from the ocean water they drink!

name: Marsh Rabbit
fact: Marsh Rabbits can't vomit - they have to eat carefully!

name: Mudskipper
fact: Mudskippers are fish that can walk on land using their fins!

name: Muskrat
fact: Muskrats can hold their breath for 20 minutes underwater!

name: Mussel
fact: Mussels produce byssal threads, often called 'beards', that are as strong as steel!

name: Newt
fact: Newts can regrow lost limbs, eyes, and even parts of their heart!

name: Nile Crocodile
fact: Nile Crocodiles can't stick out their tongue!

name: Nutria
fact: Nutrias have orange teeth from the iron in their enamel!

name: Ochre Sea Star
fact: Sea stars can regrow arms and even whole bodies!

name: Painted Turtle
fact: Painted turtles can survive being frozen solid in winter!

name: Periwinkle Snail
fact: Periwinkles close their shell door to survive low tide!

name: Piranha
fact: Piranhas bark like dogs to scare away predators!

name: Platypus
fact: Platypuses are one of few mammals that lay eggs!

name: Purple Sea Urchin
fact: Sea urchins have teeth that never stop growing!

name: Red-winged Blackbird
fact: Male red-winged blackbirds flash their red shoulders to defend territory!

name: River Otter
fact: River otters have waterproof fur and can close their nostrils and ears underwater!

name: Roseate Spoonbill
fact: Spoonbills swing their bills side to side to catch food!

name: Sally Lightfoot Crab
fact: Sally Lightfoot crabs can run across water!

name: Saltwater Crocodile
fact: Saltwater Crocodiles can't stick out their tongue!

name: Sea Lettuce
fact: Sea lettuce is actually edible and tastes like spinach!

name: Sea Palm
fact: Sea palms are seaweed that survive crashing waves!

name: Shoebill Stork
fact: Shoebills can stand completely still for hours waiting for prey!

name: Shore Crab
fact: Shore crabs can regenerate lost claws!

name: Sturgeon
fact: Sturgeons have been around since the dinosaurs!

name: Swan
fact: Swans mate for life and can live over 20 years!

name: Tidepool Sculpin
fact: Sculpins can breathe air when trapped in tide pools!

name: Water Buffalo
fact: Water buffaloes love to wallow in mud to stay cool!

name: Water Moccasin
fact: Water moccasins open their white mouths wide to scare predators!

name: Atlantic Bottlenose Dolphin
fact: Dolphins talk to their friends using clicks and whistles!

name: Blue Tang
fact: Blue tangs can change color based on their mood!

name: Butterflyfish
fact: Butterflyfish mate for life and can be seen swimming in pairs!

name: Clownfish
fact: Clownfish live in sea anemones that protect them from predators!

name: Cuttlefish
fact: Cuttlefish can change color and pattern in less than a second to communicate or hide!

name: Dugong
fact: Dugongs are the only sea mammals that eat only plants!

name: Garden Eel
fact: Garden eels live in colonies poking out of the sand!

name: Giant Clam
fact: Giant clams can live over 100 years and can weigh up to 200 kilograms!

name: Great Barracuda
fact: Barracudas can swim up to 35 miles per hour!

name: Green Sea Turtle
fact: Sea turtles can hold their breath for over 5 hours!

name: Humphead Wrasse
fact: Humphead wrasse can live over 30 years!

name: Loggerhead Turtle
fact: Loggerheads have powerful jaws to crush shellfish!

name: Manatee
fact: Manatees are known as sea cows and eat up to 10% of their body weight daily!

name: Manta Ray
fact: Manta rays have the largest brain of any fish!

name: Moorish Idol
fact: Moorish idols can change color when they sleep or get excited!

name: Parrotfish
fact: Parrotfishs can live to be 80 years old!

name: Pufferfish
fact: Pufferfish contain a poison 1,200 times more deadly than cyanide!

name: Sea Horse
fact: Sea Horses can sleep standing up!

name: Spotted Eagle Ray
fact: Spotted Eagle Rays can spot a rabbit from 2 miles away!

name: Trumpetfish
fact: Trumpetfish often swim vertically to blend in with sea fans and corals!

name: Anglerfish
fact: Female anglerfish have a glowing lure that attracts prey in the dark depths!

name: Barreleye
fact: The barreleye has a transparent head so it can look up through its skull!

name: Barreleye Fish
fact: Barreleye fish have see-through heads!

name: Beaked Whale
fact: Beaked whales can dive deeper than any other marine mammal - up to 2,992 meters!

name: Big Red Jelly
fact: The big red jelly can grow up to 1 meter across and lives at depths of 650 meters!

name: Blobfish
fact: Blobfish look normal in their deep-sea home but look blobby when brought to the surface!

name: Chimaera
fact: Chimaeras are related to sharks and have a single gill opening on each side!

name: Coffinfish
fact: Coffinfish can puff up like a balloon and have a lure on their head like an anglerfish!

name: Colossal Squid
fact: The colossal squid is heavier than a giant squid and has hooks instead of suckers!

name: Dragonfish
fact: Dragonfish have a red light that only they can see, helping them hunt without being detected!

name: Dumbo Octopus
fact: Dumbo Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood!

name: Elephant Seal
fact: Elephant seals can dive to 1,500 meters and hold their breath for two hours!

name: Elephant Shark
fact: Elephant Sharks can recognize themselves in a mirror!

name: Fangtooth
fact: Fangtooth fish have the largest teeth relative to body size of any fish!

name: Frilled Shark
fact: Frilled Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Giant Isopod
fact: Giant isopods can go 5 years without eating!

name: Giant Squid
fact: Giant squids have eyes the size of dinner plates - the largest eyes in the animal kingdom!

name: Goblin Shark
fact: Goblin Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Gulper Eel
fact: The gulper eel has a huge mouth that can swallow prey much larger than itself!

name: Hatchetfish
fact: Hatchetfish have bodies shaped like hatchets and can produce light to hide their shadow!

name: Japanese Spider Crab
fact: Japanese spider crabs can have a leg span of up to 3.7 meters!

name: Nautilus
fact: The nautilus has remained unchanged for 500 million years and uses jet propulsion to move!

name: Oarfish
fact: Oarfish can grow up to 11 meters long and are probably the source of sea serpent legends!

name: Pacific Viperfish
fact: Viperfish have fangs so big they cant close their mouth!

name: Six-gill Shark
fact: Six-gill Sharks have been around longer than trees!

name: Sperm Whale
fact: Blue whales are the biggest animals that ever lived!

name: Tripod Fish
fact: Tripod fish stand on three fin rays like a tripod to wait for food to drift by!

name: Vampire Squid
fact: Despite its scary name, the vampire squid eats only tiny particles called marine snow!

name: Viperfish
fact: Viperfish have huge fangs that are so long they can't fit inside their mouth!

name: Wolffish
fact: Wolffish have powerful jaws that can crush crabs, sea urchins, and clams!

name: Abyssal Spiderfish
fact: Spiderfish have extra-long fins that let them walk on the ocean floor like a spider!

name: Acorn Worm
fact: Acorn worms are close relatives of vertebrates and may show how our ancestors evolved!

name: Black Swallower
fact: The black swallower can eat prey 10 times its own size by unhinging its jaw!

name: Brisingid Starfish
fact: Brisingid starfish have up to 20 long arms that they use like fishing nets!

name: Comb Jelly
fact: Comb jellies have been swimming in oceans for over 500 million years, making them one of the oldest animal groups!

name: Cusk Eel
fact: Despite their name, cusk eels are actually fish, not eels!

name: Deep Sea Amphipod
fact: Deep sea amphipods can grow up to 34 centimeters long - much bigger than their shallow-water relatives!

name: Deep Sea Cucumber
fact: Deep sea cucumbers can expel part of their internal organs to distract predators, then regrow them later!

name: Deep Sea Jellyfish
fact: Some deep sea jellyfish can glow with rainbow colors to attract prey!

name: Faceless Cusk
fact: The faceless cusk has no visible eyes and its mouth is hidden underneath its head!

name: Ghost Shark
fact: Ghost sharks are ancient relatives of sharks that have been around for 400 million years!

name: Giant Tube Worm
fact: Giant tube worms can grow up to 2.4 meters long and have no mouth or stomach - they absorb nutrients through their skin!

name: Glass Sponge
fact: Glass sponges have skeletons made of silica, the same material glass is made from!

name: Grenadier Fish
fact: Grenadier fish have huge heads and long, tapering bodies that look like a grenade!

name: Lizardfish
fact: Lizardfish have needle-like teeth and can change color to match their surroundings!

name: Mariana Snailfish
fact: The Mariana snailfish lives at depths of up to 8,000 meters and is one of the deepest-living fish ever found!

name: Monophore
fact: Monophores are strange deep sea creatures that filter food from the water using special tentacles!

name: Ping Pong Tree Sponge
fact: This sponge has branches that look like ping pong paddles and can glow in the dark!

name: Sea Angel
fact: Sea angels are actually swimming sea slugs that flutter through the water like angels!

name: Sea Pen
fact: Sea pens are colonies of tiny animals that work together like a single organism!

name: Sea Pig
fact: Sea pigs are actually a type of sea cucumber that walks on the ocean floor with tube feet!

name: Siphonophore
fact: The siphonophore can grow up to 50 meters long, making it longer than a blue whale!

name: Spookfish
fact: Spookfish have a mirror-like lens in their eyes that helps them see in the dark!

name: Zombie Worm
fact: Zombie worms eat whale bones by drilling into them with acid!

name: Amphipod
fact: Amphipods are tiny shrimp-like creatures found everywhere in the ocean!

name: Bed Bug
fact: Bed bugs are tiny and hide during the day!

name: Cave Beetle
fact: Cave beetles have no eyes because they live in total darkness!

name: Cave Snail
fact: Cave snails are see-through and very rare!

name: Cockroach
fact: Cockroaches can live for a week without their head!

name: House Centipede
fact: House centipedes have 30 legs and eat other bugs!

name: Isopod
fact: Isopods look like tiny armored tanks and roll into balls!

name: Lugworm
fact: Lugworms make squiggly sand castles on the beach!

name: Mayfly
fact: Mayflies only live for one day as adults!

name: Mosquito
fact: Only female mosquitoes bite - males drink flower nectar!

name: Planarian
fact: Planarians can regrow their whole body from a tiny piece!

name: Sandhopper
fact: Sandhoppers jump 100 times their body length!

name: Silverfish
fact: Silverfish can live for a year without eating!

name: Velvet Worm
fact: Velvet worms shoot sticky slime to catch prey!

name: Water Scorpion
fact: Water scorpions breathe through a snorkel tail!

name: Water Strider
fact: Water striders walk on water using surface tension!
